panels.description: The total heap size allocated by the garbage collector, in bytes.
panels.title: gcHeapBytes_int

panels.description: The live heap size, which is the amount of memory actually being used by objects in the garbage-collected heap.
panels.title: gcLiveBytes_int

panels.description:
Measures the number of major garbage collection cycles.


A "major" garbage collection cycle occurs when the garbage collector performs a full sweep of the heap, which can be more expensive than minor collections. This metric helps you understand the frequency and intensity of your Cardano Node's garbage collection activities.
panels.title: gcMajorNum_int

panels.description:
Measures the number of minor garbage collection cycles.


A "minor" garbage collection cycle occurs when the garbage collector performs a quick scan of the heap to identify objects that are no longer in use. This is typically faster and less expensive than major garbage collections. This metric helps you understand the frequency and efficiency of your Cardano Node's garbage collection activities.
panels.title: gcMinorNum_int

panels.description:
Measures the number of ticks spent by the garbage collector.


Ticks are a unit of measurement that represents a certain amount of CPU time or processing power. This metric helps you understand how much time and resources the garbage collector is using to perform its tasks, such as collecting garbage objects and maintaining heap integrity.
panels.title: gcticks_int

panels.description:
Measures the number of ticks spent by the concurrent garbage collector (MUT) in performing its tasks.


The concurrent garbage collector (MUT) is a mechanism that allows the garbage collector to run concurrently with other threads and processes, allowing for more efficient and effective memory management. This metric helps you understand how much time and resources the MUT is using to perform its tasks, such as collecting garbage objects and maintaining heap integrity.
panels.title: mutticks_int

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated by the Garbage Collector during its last run, indicating memory allocation patterns and efficiency.
panels.title: bytes_allocated

panels.description: Total number of bytes copied by the Garbage Collector during its last run, indicating memory allocation and copying efficiency.
panels.title: bytes_copied

panels.description: This metric measures the CPU utilization time in milliseconds for garbage collection, which is a critical performance indicator.
panels.title: cpu_ms

panels.description: Tracks the cumulative total of bytes used by the Garbage Collector over time.
panels.title: cumulative_bytes_used

panels.description: tracks the number of garbage collections performed, which can help diagnose memory issues and optimize heap size.
panels.title: num_gcs

panels.description: Measures the wall clock time (i.e., actual elapsed time) for garbage collection in milliseconds,
panels.title: gc_wall_ms

panels.description: Current amount of bytes allocated to "slop" space, which represents memory reserved for future allocations but not yet in use.
panels.title: current_bytes_slop

panels.description: Total number of bytes used by the Garbage Collector.
panels.title: current_bytes_used

panels.description: Cumulative CPU time spent by the Garbage Collector (GC) during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: gc_cpu_ms

panels.description: cumulative wall clock time spent by the Garbage Collector (GC) during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: gc_wall_ms

panels.description: Cumulative CPU time spent by the Garbage Collector (GC) initialization during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: init_cpu_ms

panels.description: Cumulative wall clock time spent by the Garbage Collector (GC) initialization during its last run, in milliseconds.during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: init_wall_ms

panels.description: The maximum amount of bytes allocated to "slop" space, which represents memory reserved for future allocations but not yet in use.
panels.title: max_bytes_slop

panels.description: The maximum amount of bytes used by the Garbage Collector during its last run.
panels.title: max_bytes_used

panels.description: The cumulative CPU time spent by the mutator (i.e., the program executing in parallel with the garbage collector) during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: mutator_cpu_ms

panels.description: The cumulative wall clock time spent by the mutator (i.e., the program executing in parallel with the garbage collector) during its last run, in milliseconds.
panels.title: mutator_wall_ms

panels.description: The number of samples taken by the garbage collector to measure byte usage.
panels.title: num_bytes_usage_samples

panels.description: The number of garbage collections performed by the garbage collector.
panels.title: num_gcs

panels.description: Average number of bytes copied per parallel garbage collection.
panels.title: par_avg_bytes_copied

panels.description: The maximum number of bytes copied per parallel garbage collection.
panels.title: par_max_bytes_copied

panels.description: The total number of bytes copied by parallel garbage collection.
panels.title: par_tot_bytes_copied

panels.description: The cumulative wall clock time spent by the garbage collector.
panels.title: wall_ms

panels.description: The peak amount of memory allocated by the garbage collector, in megabytes (MB).
panels.title: peak_megabytes_allocated
